intro: Calibrachoa linoides subsp. furcata, commonly known as the golden weeping calibrachoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and profuse display of small, golden-yellow flowers. The plant produces clusters of tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for hanging baskets and containers. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant color and compact, cascading form.
